tourOverview: Choose  Ecuador  as  your  holiday  destination!  This  beautiful country  is  a  paradise  everywhere  you  look  at  it.  Let  yourself  be amazed  by  its  culture  expressed  majestically  in  its  churches, buildings, and heritage cities. In Quito, discover the best-preserved Historic Center in South America. In the Coast you'll fall in love with its views, beaches, and the abundance of fauna that they enclose. Increase  your  adrenaline  by  practicing  a  variety  of  adventure sports  that  Ecuador  has  to  offer.  And  do  not  forget  to  delight yourself  with  the  taste  of  its  gastronomic  diversity,  which  you'll find while touring this country full of magic and charm.

dayByDay.dayDescription: Upon your arrival in the city of Quito, our private transport will take us to our hotel. Our check-in will be followed by a destination and itinerary briefing with our local staff and Tour Leader.

In the morning after breakfast, we will start the tour with a visit to the Plaza de la Independencia, where the Presidential Palace, the Cathedral and the El Sagrario Church are located. We will visit the Church of La Compañía (1605), with its impressive golden altars. This is considered as one of the best examples of baroque art in America. Then we will take you to the church and monastery of San Francisco (1535). This is one of the oldest Ecuadorian churches and the main altar inside we can see a spectacular example of baroque carving. We will also observe an excellent collection of works of art, which includes paintings, sculptures and furniture dating from the 16th century. Finally, we will go to the viewpoint highest in the historic center, the hill 'El Panecillo' from where we will have a spectacular view of Quito. Lunch time   your own. In the afternoon we will go to the north of the city towards the Middle of the World, this is the site where, in 1736, the expedition of Charles-Marie de la Condamine made the measurements that showed that this was indeed the equator. Here visitors have the rare opportunity to be in two hemispheres at the same time! Same time! A monument was built to mark the site, inside it we can visit the excellent ethnographic museum. Then we will visit Intiñan museum, the perfect place to experience some phenomenon that occurs when you live on the equatorial line. Here our guide will also explain how Andean culture is related to our location in the world. Return to hotel

After breakfast we will travel to the city of Otavalo, home of the laborious Otavalo Indigenous Community. We will check in- and head out for lunch (on your own). After lunch we’ll visit to the colorful Indigenous market in Otavalo, the largest indigenous market of its kind in South America. You’ll arrive just in time to bargain for beautiful tapestries, local paintings, hand-knitted wool sweaters, socks and gloves, wood carvings, silver jewelry, embroidered blouses, and straw hats, to name only a few of the items on offer. After lunch we drive east to the base of the Imbabura volcano to make an easy walk to the Peguche waterfall ,considered by the local Indigenous people a sacred place. This is a nice easy walk through the forest ending with the view of the beautiful waterfall. Hotel in Otavalo

In the morning we will go for a short walk around the beautiful Cuicocha Lake located at the foothills of the high Cotacachi Volcano. During the hike we will observe several high Andean native plants such as the Pumamaki, Lupines, Chuquiraguas, etc. If we are lucky perhaps, we can glance at the flight of the Condor. There is a possibility of having a boat ride on the lake. After lunch (on your own), we’ll head to Cotacachi, a small town known for its high-quality leather goods, and indigenous heritage alive today

Early in the morning we will drive for about 3 hours towards the beautiful highlands of Papallacta. On the way on we will stop at Cayambe town to try the delicious biscochos and the “manjar de leche” caramel. Then we will continue towards the Papallacta Highlands, a beautiful place surrounded by green cloud forest mountains where we find the ‘Termas de Papallacta’ Resort, a nice place with lot of green areas and where kids and adults can enjoy the hot water springs. We then continued our drive east and passing the town of Baeza towards the city of Tena. (Lunch on your own). Then we continue our drive for about 1.5 hours to arrive at Santa Rosa village from where a 25–30-minute canoe ride will take us to Yacuma Lodge located on a beautiful spot in the deep jungle, and where you will be welcomed by a typical cold drink. Here we will have time to settle in the lodge’s comfortable bungalows. Before dinner accompanied by our native guide, we will go fishing for piranhas

After breakfast, and in the company of one of our expert’s local indigenous guides, we will take a 2 hour walk through the jungle to know more about medicinal jungle plants. After lunch, we will visit to the Quechua indigenous community of Chontayacu, where you will have the opportunity to learn about local customs and the way of life in the jungle. Here we can test our pottery making skills, purchase some locally produced works of art, and visit the local school. Later in the afternoon, return to the lodge for dinner.
dayInclusions: breakfast, lunch, dinner and Accommodation at Yacuma Jungle Ecolodge

dayByDay.dayDescription: After breakfast, we will visit “Amazoonico”, a wildlife rescue center and where we can observe different species which were rescued from illegal animal traffic. Then we will go by canoe to the shores of the Napo River to try our luck in gold panning. Then later in the afternoon we will prepare traditional handmade chocolate with organic grains cultivated by the community. After dinner we will celebrate around the fire our last day in Yacuma, we will enjoy a social meeting with wood fire with a typical drink of the jungle
dayInclusions: breakfast, lunch, dinner and Accommodation at Yacuma Jungle Ecolodge

dayByDay.dayDescription: Yacuma is an extraordinary spot for birdwatching and an early morning wakeup call will take us to a Clay Lick, where tens of parrots enjoy munching on the minerals on the clay walls. After breakfast and a relaxing time, we will canoe back to Santa Rosa village from where we will start our drive towards the city of Baños. On the way on we will stop at Puyo town where we find the “balsa” handicraft shops. Then later on passing the small towns of Rio Verde and Rio Negro we will arrive to a place where we make a walk to observe the impressive “Pailon del Diablo” (Devil’s Cauldron) waterfall. Using a cable car we can cross the deep Pastaza River canyon, a challenging adventure. Finally, we will arrive in the town of Baños where we will be allocated a comfortable hotel, after about a 4-and-a-half-hour drive.

This day you can enjoy of a variety of adventure and relaxing options around the picturesque town of Baños, such as white-water rafting, horseback riding around the beautiful highlands, a challenging mountain bike tour, or relax in one of the hot springs or small cafes that Baños has to offer. The activities depend on the interests of the group and must be organized with the TL.

In the morning and after breakfast we will drive towards the city of Ambato. On the way we will stop at the town of the Salasaca, well known for its interesting dresses and for the beautiful tapestries produced here. Then we will continue to Ambato city from where we drive towards the highlands of the immense Chimborazo, an extinct volcano which, for a long time was considered the highest mountain in the world (however and it is important to know that measured from the center of earth in fact Chimborazo is the highest peak on the terrestrial globe). Here we can observe the gracious Vicuñas, a highland Camelid. We’ll walk around the Whymper refuge, located at 5,042 m. We suggest you take sweets with you in case of altitude sickness and wear the appropriate clothing for this altitude such as a windbreaker, non-slip hiking or running shoes, and clothing that protects against possible rain and cold wind. Later, we continue our drive until we arrive in our hotel in the city of Riobamba.

Early morning, we will continue our way towards Ingapirca where we will find the fascinating pre-Inca and Inca Ruins, but not before stopping by a viewpoint of the “Devil’s Nose train. Ingapirca was used for astronomical observations, agricultural calendars, and religious ceremonies. After visiting Ingapirca the trip continues to the charming city of Cuenca.

The Cajas National Park is one of the most important natural reserves of southern Ecuador. It is the main source of water for Cuenca, and an IBA (important bird area), dedicated to conservation. These highlands are full of incredible landscapes, animals and creatures, and well-preserved forests. We will do a full day excursion to Cajas national park and return in the afternoon to Cuenca.

The southern city of Cuenca is one of the most important of Ecuador. With incredible colonial influence, gorgeous landscapes and a friendly vibe, the city is one of the most welcoming in South America. We will explore the main highlights of the city on foot and driving from the city center

In the morning, we will travel to the city of Guayaquil, the biggest city in Ecuador, and one of the most modern ports of the Pacific Ocean. We’ll check in at our hotel accommodation in Guayaquil, before heading out to explore the city. Our visits can include Bolivar Park with the famous green iguanas that inhabit this place, the ‘Malecon’ boardwalk of Guayaquil and the great ‘Historical Park’

Transfer to the airport for your flight to Galapagos. Upon your arrival at the small city of Puerto Baquerizo in San Cristobal Island, we will transfer you to the Hotel. After lunch (on your own) we will visit the Interpretation Centre of San Cristobal where our guides will explain about the Galapagos Islands, their formation, people, and fauna. We will then visit the “Cerro de las Tijeretas” which is a unique site to observe two types of frigates birds nesting in the same colony. The view and the landscapes are very beautiful. At the base of Tijeretas Hill we find a nice bay where is possible to snorkel with sea lions in a clear blue bay. Return to the town, and on the way, on a nearby beach you can observe playful sea lions.

dayByDay.dayTitle: San Cristobal – Highlands – Breading Center – Puerto Chino
dayByDay.dayDescription: This day we’ll enjoy of a full day guided tour to visit the highlands of San Cristobal: Cerro Colorado Tortoise Breading Center, known as “La Galapaguera”, is a sanctuary for giant Galapagos tortoises, where you can observe this exotic animal in a semi-natural state. Here you can walk ecological trails, where you will delight in observing birds and native vegetation of San Cristóbal. The complex also has a complete information center that reveals the great variety of Galapagos tortoises throughout the archipelago. Then we will visit Junco Lagoon, that is a freshwater reservoir formed by a natural crater of volcanic origin on the heights of San Cristóbal Island, a good site for birdwatching. Finally, we will visit “Puerto Chino”, one of the most beautiful white coral-sand beaches, home to a small Galapagos Sea Lion colony, marine Iguanas, Sally Lightfoot Crabs, and a variety of shorebirds.

Early in the morning, we start our navigation towards the historic Floreana Island. We will take a traditional transportation called “chiva” where we will go towards the highlands of Floreana, to an area known as “Asilo de la Paz”. Then, we will go towards Playa Negra, here we will have the opportunity to practice some snorkel (equipment not included, rental available).  After lunch (on your own) we start our navigation towards Isabela Island, the biggest on the Archipelago of Galapagos. After 2 hours of navigation, we will arrive at the town of Pto. Villamil and arrange your transfer to the hotel.

dayByDay.dayTitle: Sierra Negra Volcano & Tintoreras tour (pool basis)
dayByDay.dayDescription: In the morning, our transport will take us up to the highlands of Isabela Island. After arriving at the National Park checkpoint, we will start our easy hike up to the rim of the crater of the Sierra Negra volcano. This crater, considered amongst the largest in the world (approximately 11 kms diameter), is one of the most impressive examples of the volcanic activity in the Islands. In the bottom of the crater, we can observe cooled down lava flows from recent eruptions. Return to our hike starting point and then by car transport back to Pto. Villamil. In the afternoon after lunch, we go for a shared tour to the place known as las Tintoreras, a place where we can observe sharks, marine turtles, marine iguanas, and with luck, some penguins, as well as snorkel. Transport back to the hotel and free time to rest and enjoy the beach of this tranquil, beautiful Island in the Pacific Ocean.

After breakfast, we will visit the fantastic Tortoise Breading Center and explore the area known as Humedales (Wetlands of Isabela) by walking on its well-kept boardwalk. Here we have a chance of observing fantastic shorebirds of the area, including the fantastic Flamingo subspecies that lives in the Galapagos. We will then board our speedboat and head back the Island of Santa Cruz. Upon arrival at Santa Cruz and after check in the hotel, we go for a visit to the well-known Charles Darwin Station, tortoise breading center of Santa Cruz Island

Morning transfer to the Airport located on Baltra Island for your fly to Guayaquil where you will be connecting with your international flight back home. On the way to Baltra Island we will make a stop to observe “Los Gemelos” twin crater formation

prices.priceNotice: hotel categories will depend on locally available properties

included: hotels: double room accommodation with private facilities
